item.title: Creating a CLI with Rust
item.description: Setup Before getting into our hacker mood, let’s create a cargo project and install the packages we’ll need: cargo new ferris-say Now, open your Cargo.toml, and add this below [dependencies]: [dependencies] ansi_term = "0.12.1" clap = { version = "3.1.6", features = ["derive"] } Or, if you have cargo edit (which I prefer using), write right in your terminal: cargo add ansi_term cargo add clap --features derive After it’s installed, we’re ready to go to the next step.
